meanings.definition: A temporary or improvised substitute or solution.
meanings.sent1: During the camping trip, we used makeshifts like branches and leaves to create shelter.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, people often rely on makeshifts to solve immediate problems.
meanings.sent3: The makeshifts made from cardboard boxes turned our backyard into a cozy fort.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a treasure trove of makeshifts, always ready to solve any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The makeshifts of old newspapers and tape held together surprisingly well in the storm.

meanings.definition: Something that is used as a temporary measure or expedient.
meanings.sent1: The students used makeshifts like rulers and pencils to measure the length of the room.
meanings.sent2: During the power outage, candles became our makeshifts for light.
meanings.sent3: His excuses were like flimsy makeshifts, easily seen through by everyone.
meanings.sent4: The makeshifts of borrowed tools helped him finish the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The makeshifts of plastic cups and string served as a telephone for the kids.
